abstract: Lots of fund managers say they are bullish on Wall Street — but they aren’t necessarily investing that way. In fact, managers of the largest mutual funds seem to be avoiding substantial stakes in Wall Street’s top firms, a trend that Tobias Levkovich, the chief United States investment strategist at Citi, calls “surprising.”
lead_paragraph: Lots of fund managers say they are bullish on Wall Street — but they aren’t necessarily investing that way. In fact, managers of the largest mutual funds seem to be avoiding substantial stakes in Wall Street’s top firms, a trend that Tobias Levkovich, the chief United States investment strategist at Citi, calls “surprising.”

headline.main: Mutual Funds Go Light on Wall Street Stocks
